Hi

We've been using JUnitEE for a year now, but I'm currently looking 
into using 1.6 for the command line automation features. 

Previously we had all our production code and test code in the 
ejb.jar of our application, not the web.war, which holds only the 
presentation layer. Both are put together into an ear for deployment 
to the app server. 

I'd much prefer to keep the build process and structure for the unit 
test ears as similar to the production ears as possible. This means 
*not* packaging everything under WEB-INF/lib, but keeping our current 
structure. 

I'd like to use the Smart Test Mode, but have resorted to the 
testCase.txt file route. I can get it to pick up the txt file and 
display it, but can't get it to find the associated test cases as 
they're in the ejb.jar. I'd prefer to use the Smart Test mode for 
ease of use. So, how do I spec the path within the searchResources 
target ?, ie :
      <param-name>searchResources</param-name>
      <param-value>test.jar</param-value>

Thanks in advance for any help

Scott
